page.title: 14MELBOURNE'S LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: THE MOST COMMON THEORY ABOUT THE DERIVATION OF MELBOURNE'S NAME IS THAT THE SPELLING IN THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY BOOK "MILEBURN" MEANS THE MILL STREAM. THIS IS THOUGHT TO BE THE MOST LIKELY EXPLANATION."MELBURN",AN ALTERNATIVE SPELLING,MEANS THE SWEET STREAM AND "MELDBURN" DENOTES THAT MELD,A WEED EATEN IN SAXON TIMES GREW PLENTIFULLY AROUND HERE.MELBOURNE HAS ALSO BEEN CALLED THE PLACE OF SWEET SPRINGS BECAUSE OF ITS PLENTIFUL WATER SUPPLY OF SPRINGWATER. HISTORICAL SITES IN THE AREA INCLUDE A MEDIEVAL HOLY WELL WHICH HAS RECENTLY BEEN RESTORED BY THE CIVIC SOCIETY. THE SAD REMAINS OF A NORMAN CASTLE CAN BE FOUND IN CASTLE FARM.MELBOURNE IS THE BIRTHPLACE OF THOMAS COOK,OF TRAVEL COMPANY FAME.THERE IS ALSO AN HISTORICAL LINK WITH MELBOURNE, AUSTRALIA,WHICH IS OUR SMALL "SISTER".
